programs.name: HIMS
programs.description: A digital platform for managing health records, ensuring smooth healthcare service delivery, and improving administrative efficiencies in hospitals.

programs.name: RCH Portal
programs.description: A web-based platform aimed at improving maternal and child health by tracking health services, providing access to necessary resources, and monitoring progress.

programs.name: IEC
programs.description: A program focused on spreading awareness and educating the public on health-related topics, preventive measures, and promoting healthy lifestyles.

programs.name: QA Kayakalp
programs.description: A quality improvement initiative aimed at enhancing cleanliness, hygiene, and overall patient experience in healthcare facilities.

programs.name: HRIS
programs.description: A system designed to manage and track human resources within healthcare institutions, including personnel data, performance, and workforce management.

programs.name: Performance Benchmarking
programs.description: A program aimed at measuring the performance of healthcare facilities based on predefined criteria, ensuring better healthcare delivery and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.

programs.name: Act like PCPNDT
programs.description: A program focused on the implementation of the PCPNDT Act to prevent gender-based sex selection and ensure equal rights for girls and boys.

programs.name: Clinical Establishment Act and other Acts
programs.description: A set of regulations governing the functioning of healthcare establishments to ensure quality services, patient rights, and the ethical functioning of medical professionals.

programs.name: IEDisability Camps and UDID
programs.description: A program aimed at organizing disability camps for identification and certification, alongside the creation of a Unique Disability ID for persons with disabilities.

programs.name: NITI Aayog
programs.description: A government think tank that works on transforming health outcomes by supporting initiatives for sustainable development and better healthcare access across regions.

programs.name: Trainings
programs.description: Regular training programs for healthcare professionals to enhance skills, knowledge, and efficiency in delivering quality healthcare services.

programs.name: 108-NAS
programs.description: A 24/7 emergency ambulance service that provides pre-hospital care and rapid transport to patients in emergencies across the country.
An emergency helpline number offering ambulance services to people in need of urgent medical transport, with a focus on critical care.

programs.name: Mera Aspatal
programs.description: A platform that allows citizens to provide feedback on healthcare facilities, ensuring transparency, accountability, and improving service quality.

programs.name: Free Diagnostics
programs.description: A government initiative that provides free diagnostic services to all citizens, ensuring timely medical diagnosis and better health outcomes.

programs.name: PMJAY/HIMCARE
programs.description: A flagship health insurance program offering free healthcare to low-income families, covering hospitalization expenses and critical treatments.

programs.name: Transport
programs.description: Ensures efficient transportation services, including ambulances and patient transport for accessing health facilities, especially in remote areas.

programs.name: NTCP
programs.description: A public health initiative aimed at reducing tobacco consumption through awareness campaigns, tobacco control policies, and rehabilitation programs.

programs.name: Mental Health
programs.description: Focused on addressing mental health issues, offering counseling, support, and treatment to individuals with mental health disorders, ensuring better mental well-being.

programs.name: De-addiction
programs.description: A program designed to help individuals struggling with addiction through treatment, rehabilitation, and awareness programs, promoting a drug-free society.

programs.name: WHC MMU
programs.description: Mobile healthcare units that provide specialized medical care and services to women in rural and remote areas, ensuring better access to healthcare.

programs.name: RKS & JAS
programs.description: Community-based healthcare initiatives that promote patient welfare, support healthcare management, and foster public participation in health governance.

programs.name: COTPA ACT
programs.description: An act that regulates the advertisement, sale, and consumption of tobacco products to curb tobacco-related health issues and protect non-smokers.

programs.name: Hub and Spoke
programs.description: A healthcare delivery model where specialized care (hub) is provided in central locations, with outreach services (spokes) extending to remote areas to ensure comprehensive health access.

programs.name: IRAD NPCCH
programs.description: A data-driven initiative for collecting and analyzing road accident data, aiming to improve road safety and reduce fatalities through targeted interventions.

programs.name: Maternal & Child Health
programs.description: A program dedicated to improving the health and well-being of mothers and children through healthcare services, nutritional support, and preventive measures aimed at reducing maternal and child mortality.

programs.name: RBSK
programs.description: A program designed to provide healthcare services to children and adolescents, focusing on the early detection and treatment of diseases, disabilities, and deficiencies.

programs.name: Immunization
programs.description: A program aimed at vaccinating children and adults to prevent the spread of infectious diseases and protect communities through herd immunity.

programs.name: RKSK
programs.description: A program focused on improving the health of adolescents by providing education on reproductive health, nutrition, mental health, and the prevention of substance abuse.

programs.name: MHP
programs.description: A health program designed to monitor and manage healthcare professionalsâ€™ performance, ensuring optimal staffing and resource allocation within healthcare institutions.

programs.name: WIFS (Anaemia Mukt Bharat)
programs.description: A health initiative aimed at reducing anemia among women and children through iron supplementation, dietary improvements, and education on anemia prevention.

programs.name: Free Drugs Services & DVDMS/Store
programs.description: A program that provides essential medicines free of cost to individuals, ensuring better access to healthcare and addressing gaps in medication availability in remote areas.

programs.name: Sahara Yojna
programs.description: A welfare scheme designed to provide financial and medical support to vulnerable individuals, including those with chronic illnesses or in need of urgent care.

programs.name: NCPB
programs.description: National Program for Prevention and Control of Birth Defects, a program aimed at preventing congenital anomalies and providing health services for affected newborns.

programs.name: NPPCD
programs.description: National Program for Prevention and Control of Deafness, which focuses on early detection, prevention, and treatment of hearing loss in children and adults.

programs.name: NOHP
programs.description: A health program offering regular training for healthcare professionals to enhance their skills, knowledge, and efficiency in delivering quality services to communities.

programs.name: DTO (RNTCP, MMKRNY)
programs.description: A program under the Revised National Tuberculosis Control Program (RNTCP) focused on controlling tuberculosis through early detection, treatment, and monitoring, along with the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) to ensure livelihood support for affected families.

programs.name: NLEP
programs.description: National Leprosy Eradication Program (NLEP) aims to eliminate leprosy through early diagnosis, treatment, and providing support for rehabilitation of individuals affected by the disease.

programs.name: IDSP
programs.description: The Integrated Disease Surveillance Program (IDSP) aims to strengthen disease surveillance systems across India, detecting outbreaks and preventing the spread of communicable diseases.

programs.name: NVBDCP
programs.description: The National Vector-Borne Disease Control Program (NVBDCP) focuses on preventing and controlling vector-borne diseases like malaria, dengue, and chikungunya through surveillance, vector control, and public awareness campaigns.

programs.name: DAPO
programs.description: The District Ayurvedic Programme Officer (DAPO) is designed to promote and regulate the practices of Ayurveda at the district level, ensuring the availability of quality Ayurvedic services for public health.

programs.name: Blood Storage Units
programs.description: A program aimed at establishing and managing blood storage units to ensure the availability of safe blood for transfusions in hospitals, improving emergency care, and saving lives.

programs.name: NVHCP
programs.description: The National Vector-Human Control Program (NVHCP) focuses on controlling diseases transmitted through vectors, such as malaria and dengue, by reducing the human-vector interaction and improving community-level disease control measures.

programs.name: VBDCP
programs.description: The Vector-Borne Disease Control Program (VBDCP) aims to control and prevent diseases such as malaria, dengue, and chikungunya by targeting their vectors and promoting community participation in disease management.

programs.name: RABIES (NRCP)
programs.description: The National Rabies Control Program (NRCP) aims to reduce human rabies deaths through vaccination of stray dogs, public awareness campaigns, and the provision of post-exposure prophylaxis for individuals exposed to rabies.

programs.name: Family Planning
programs.description: Programs aimed at providing reproductive health services, promoting birth control methods, and ensuring informed choices for family planning, including menstrual hygiene and access to gynecological care.

programs.name: Community Process and NUHM
programs.description: A program focusing on increasing awareness of prevention and testing, in collaboration with NGOs, to promote health services at the community level under the National Urban Health Mission (NUHM).

programs.name: Poshan Abhiyan
programs.description: A nationwide initiative to improve nutritional outcomes for women and children by focusing on awareness, behavior change, and ensuring access to nutritious food.

programs.name: Disaster
programs.description: A program focused on providing immediate healthcare response and support during and after natural or man-made disasters, ensuring that relief efforts are effective in minimizing health risks.

programs.name: JICA Project
programs.description: A collaboration with the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) aimed at improving healthcare systems and infrastructure through technical assistance, knowledge sharing, and capacity building.

programs.name: Adarsh Swasth Sansthan
programs.description: A healthcare initiative aimed at establishing model healthcare institutions with a focus on high standards of service delivery, quality care, and patient satisfaction.

programs.name: BMBMP
programs.description: Bihar Municipal and Management Program (BMBMP) focuses on enhancing public health systems in urban areas through improved governance, infrastructure, and access to basic healthcare services.

programs.name: Palliative Care & NPHCE
programs.description: Programs that provide comprehensive palliative care for terminally ill patients and the National Program for Health Care of the Elderly (NPHCE), focused on improving the quality of life for the elderly and addressing their healthcare needs.

programs.name: Dialysis
programs.description: A program providing dialysis treatment services to patients with kidney failure, ensuring access to life-saving treatments at affordable rates in public healthcare settings.

programs.name: NIDDCP
programs.description: National Integrated Diabetes and Diabetic Care Program (NIDDCP) aims to prevent and control diabetes through early screening, treatment, and awareness, ensuring better management of diabetic conditions.

programs.name: Civil Works
programs.description: A program focused on the construction, renovation, and maintenance of healthcare infrastructure, including hospitals, clinics, and other health-related facilities to ensure better access to healthcare.

programs.name: Telemedicine
programs.description: A technology-driven program offering remote consultations, diagnostics, and healthcare services, aiming to improve access to medical care in rural and underserved areas.

programs.name: E-Office
programs.description: An initiative to digitalize office workflows, streamline administrative processes, and enhance efficiency in government healthcare institutions through the adoption of e-governance tools.

programs.name: NCD & HWC
programs.description: Programs focusing on the prevention and control of Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs) like cancer, diabetes, and cardiovascular diseases, integrated with Health and Wellness Centers (HWC) for community-level interventions.

programs.name: STEMI
programs.description: A specialized program focused on the rapid identification and treatment of STEMI (ST-Elevation Myocardial Infarction), a severe heart attack, using early interventions like thrombolysis and emergency medical services.
